D1DBE75FE39241AB865C914EFED8076D.description:
examining the driver’s legal responsibilities at a crash scene (Code of Virginia §

31C3AFE740704DCB8008739BAB39E61F.description: investigating the consequences of moving violations and demerit points; and

D4B492B6D7DA4EB1ACBF861EDA8859C1.description:

and the steps to take if involved in or a witness to a crash. Key concepts/skills include

FB2BD70EA12B4F76B273BAD8B3EF3D9C.description:
demonstrating an understanding of energy conservation, alternative or renewable sources
of energy, conservation of natural resources, and green driving practices (e.g., smooth

DB7AB0F49CA640EB98F8BDF1AB81103E.description:
investigating appropriate disposal of batteries, fluids, tires, and other environmentally

255028CB58304EB482A6DE36D9474FAF.description:
examining the health risks of air pollution and how some passenger vehicles produce

2159381FFE8F4DCDACF8EB5953675511.description:
comparing and evaluating the environmental impact of using public transportation,
walking, cycling, ridesharing, and carpooling;

7DC9C92B587540A4B7CA58D176FDF1C6.description:
analyzing how all-electric, hybrid electric, hydrogen fuel cell, ethanol, biodiesel, and
natural gas-powered vehicles conserve fuel and lower vehicle emissions;

EB2BB962960C40E484856D2F43BEA5B3.description:
The student will research and evaluate the environmental impact of transportation options
and how to choose fuel-efficient vehicles. Key concepts/skills include

DCC6E9F327BB4EB8AFD6EE1EA17F5FE9.description:
demonstrating an understanding of safe and legal practices for using navigation tools
while driving.

C19979F3D73F4F78BC2E3C00DBE23F30.description:
calculating the cost of a trip to include fuel, tolls, daily and total mileage, fuel efficiency,
food, hotels, and other variables; and

254BFA3549B244AAAA70240062C6C431.description:
creating an itinerary, calculating total trip time, investigating alternative routes, traffic,
rest stops, and other options;-

C7648C758B4E4EABA926BF20401DDD76.description:
The student will demonstrate competent map-reading and road-trip-planning skills by
utilizing available resources. Key concepts/skills include

53CFC3C2E6E643458B096E9EB10A892D.description:
calculating depreciation and estimating a budget for routine maintenance and repair costs

622A3F859A53431292A6ED638A50A0DE.description:
evaluating the advantages and disadvantages of purchasing or leasing an all-electric,
hybrid electric, hydrogen fuel cell, ethanol, biodiesel, natural gas or traditional gaspowered vehicle; and

72ABD1FC75C14DF5839679B79395160A.description: analyzing vehicle inspection and emissions requirements;

03CBB16635DA472A973D9D179ECD57EB.description: demonstrating an understanding of title and vehicle and registration requirements;

892E1830C9F746DCB3C3A557CFE22216.description: differentiating between required and optional insurance coverage;

07866F0408AD4CDC99F91E012C68CB3A.description:
demonstrating an understanding of the Financial Responsibility Law (Code of Virginia §

37D95D0EF287440F9BBB0F0A9BDB686E.description:

699C50CBD83C4567AAA10802AB40A68C.description: fluids, cooling systems, and belts; and

83EFF13F5D74433A98D77FEC9C201145.description:
demonstrating and evaluating appropriate use of controlled braking, trail braking, and
threshold braking;

EFFFCBE0DCBA4C5EA81355E8732B0CC1.description:
demonstrating proper use of conventional hydraulic brake systems and understanding of
new technologies such as regenerative braking;

61F0A18AC4454B35B6C6F67F6F46BB21.description:
The student will compare vehicle braking systems and explain proper braking techniques

C20BD1F65B654C0FB777DF8A7B628605.description: farm machinery and horse-drawn vehicles; and

7A696A5796BE41D6AB391D8995570C6C.description: sport utility vehicles, recreation vehicles, and trailers;

B251231A87094E5BB475D6EB48A08D9E.description:
The student will identify and describe the performance characteristics of other road users
and apply problem-solving skills to minimize risks when sharing the roadway. Key concepts/
skills include investigating the unique characteristics and vulnerabilities of

2C389854045B4E63B58040D3AE2B0029.description: demonstrating a gradual stepwise approach to safe off-road recovery.

8672E444890B42CFA051981E4C08BF31.description:
recognizing how decisions are influenced and limited by the environment, the vehicle,

844D4495C7FB441E82A2CAE4D9F0E569.description: identifying open space as an emergency escape route;

D76ABDA070654B858C5CC4DF7239B7B9.description:
analyzing and demonstrating evasive maneuvers, using braking and steering

7EB9C17D889E455381A8C9ACFDDF352E.description:
The student will identify and evaluate emergency-response strategies to avoid or reduce
the severity of a collision. Key concepts/skills include

CD033E44884648C7ADD5962CB216F07B.description:
analyzing the transformative potential of new mobility options and employment
opportunities that automated vehicles may provide for millions of people with
disabilities.

7B69857DAB1249F5B90EE34DEC326664.description:
analyzing the impact of fully autonomous safety features (e.g., autopilot self-driving
vehicles that will integrate onto roadways by progressing through six levels of driver
assistance technology advancements in coming years); and

FC2CBD45E6F24AABAF71697346ACED08.description:
researching partially automated safety features (e.g., lane keeping assist, adaptive cruise
control, traffic jam assist, self-park);

F8232BA3D76C4BC69C52C02CF84C3547.description:
comparing efficacy of passive occupant protection systems to include thorax, curtain,
knee and other airbags and adaptive cervical head restraint systems;

575E662E04B94DCDAE8D0FD741E5B1AF.description:
demonstrating an understanding of advanced safety features (e.g., electronic stability
control systems, blind spot detection, forward collision warning, lane departure warning);

F0F49537921D456B9B03F3CFFF2BF31E.description:
The student will analyze how technological innovations affect driving practices and
reduce human error. Key concepts/skills include

4DADE4C567C94127A4F516C8609173C3.description:
analyzing automotive safety and highway transportation system career options based on
personal interests, abilities, achievements, and goals.

01C107B6A6AB4DE5BF77A77F46E61E2C.description:
researching Virginia’s occupant protection laws and understanding the dangers of riding
in the bed of a truck; and

F26729630A164059894073AD6B4AAB2F.description:
investigating legal obligation, ethical decision making, and the importance of advocating
for proper use of vehicle occupant-protection devices; and

409567B77E2B45438CE1EDA0050D56AA.description: analyzing the effect of seating and steering wheel position on injury severity;

810C11134690434C9F165261B5513A37.description:
investigating the efficacy of active restraint systems (e.g., seat belts, head restraints, child
safety seats);

D4D6DA10B6F848B29881DCAC5C07D94A.description:
The student will demonstrate an understanding of the proper use of vehicle occupantprotection features and analyze how they can reduce injury severity and increase collision

BF58B20AFC95493DAC1C1C0B877512CC.description:
examining the difference between electronic vehicle stability control and traction control

5901826748EC495DAFE607C8F42B6FE3.description:
demonstrating an understanding and responding appropriately to road construction and
other adverse road conditions; and

BEEF6AB072BD4092A644C1B0F7604FF8.description:
evaluating multiple solutions for smoke- and weather-related conditions that reduce
visibility;

B5E90CFCB7A748B788289D02C34B0343.description:
mitigating limitations (e.g., nighttime visibility, overdriving headlights, curve-adaptive
headlights) when driving at night;

397145A236C14B8CB954795A712FF33A.description:
The student will identify changes in the environment that affect visibility and traction and
evaluate appropriate communication, speed, and lane position adjustment to reduce risks. Key
concepts/skills include

24101B96F7DB46EBBE352D2A407F3D1A.description:
demonstrating an understanding of distracted driving laws and analyzing the cost of

EFF8AC7B21FB403591508B01B7042521.description:
evaluating the impact of exterior distractions ( e.g., looking at crash scenes, places of
interest, billboards, emergency vehicles); and

221BB5A15DD84FBE9D4DE3EDA4802DD6.description: identifying interior distractions (e.g., interactive technologies, passengers, pets, insects);

15D529CD4A0B42F288528281C8EF38D8.description:
gathering and analyzing strategies to prevent distractions that take the driver’s eyes off
the road and hands off the wheel;

C4AFFF3A86FD487DB34FF8E23851FF64.description:
The student will identify visual, auditory, manual, and cognitive distractions that divert
attention from the driving task and analyze how divided visual and mental attention contribute to
driver error. Key concepts/skills include

6E2A8778B1154C11A699B8229877A5C6.description: evaluating how chronic health conditions may affect driver performance.

A9411FBF82514063A0078D10039E953B.description:
comparing the effect of short- and long-term physical and cognitive disorders on the
driving tasks; and

B692AFDD11404C449A959752B409F90D.description: analyzing the relationship between circadian rhythms and sleep deprivation;

0B976AB8F84640318D258360B5879826.description: identifying fatigue warning signs and countermeasures;

76E793B275834153B80325454A021089.description:
The student will analyze the effects of fatigue and other conditions that impact driver
performance. Key concepts include

53565B361A1A44789E96777A5CFD1DF2.description: quantifying the legal and financial consequences of reckless driving and road rage.

C9B0E17956DE4E98BB4156F05A68CBAF.description:
analyzing how aggressive driving and road rage pose a threat to the health and safety of
everyone on the road; and

1B2D3122A5D04342A58B936BB36B2F33.description: identifying how anger management strategies reduce hostility and frustration;

94498460B4A8416E8F8C4B597A4D8D37.description: evaluating how stress and anxiety affect driver fitness and mental preparedness;

D2A4AB1D7A9044E8919B2B380A02B3B8.description:
The student will recognize the consequences of aggressive driving and the influence of
emotions on driving behaviors. Key concepts/skills include

294A2AA82CC14B4686A5DC4ED5EB1B0A.description:
evaluating the effectiveness of alternative safe transportation programs as
countermeasures for reducing impaired driving.

D6CBB1A134DC4702933FE7C108E3A6C6.description:
analyzing court costs, insurance requirements, Virginia Alcohol Safety Action Program
referral, and other penalties associated with impaired driving; and

3D195D95E8264608A3811453993DB657.description:
researching Administrative License Revocation, loss of license, ignition interlock and
other licensing restrictions,

FAD181D39417441CA81AF283419E949C.description:
comparing Implied Consent, Zero Tolerance and Use and Lose laws and demonstrating
an understanding of why driving while impaired is illegal;

01A4C6D7745A4E3CBBAD59706BA8D9F9.description:
describing the mediating influence of refusal and peer-intervention skills on preventing
alcohol, marijuana, and other drug misuse;

544266A3C0F84CFE89179A5961BE9977.description: analyzing the impact of positive and negative peer pressure;

0B688555DF43495CBAEF06962228EB6E.description:
The student will identify and analyze the legal and economic consequences associated
with alcohol, marijuana, and other drug use while driving. Key concepts/skills include

0C6DB2FD0D5C454498C9A8E746B12B1C.description:
examining physiological and biological factors that influence how alcohol, marijuana,
and other drugs are absorbed, metabolized, and eliminated from the body.

05422FEECE0243F5A18C084966212C80.description:
analyzing how the synergistic effects of using two or more drugs at the same time can
amplify the impairing effects of each drug; and

5863041126524074A5B556572E278AFA.description:
researching the effects of alcohol, marijuana, and other drugs on vision and space
management;

74B7A053695348F480FDB0EAA23C5FC5.description:
demonstrating an understanding that driving while impaired by any substance (legal or
illegal drugs) places the driver and others in harm’s way.

3F4A2D5ABB26420A9D857445DA2FD174.description:
evaluating the impact of prescription and nonprescription medications on mood,
personality, risk taking, coordination, judgment, reaction time, and driver performance;

5D708DA66FF34F00B809AC193E7C522D.description:
The student will analyze and describe the physiological, psychological, and cognitive
effects of alcohol, marijuana and other drugs and their impact on a driver’s awareness of risks,
and involvement in collisions. Key concepts/skills include

9158C196AF5F4640A43F88BBA915F9C3.description: demonstrating hand signals for slow/stop, right turn and left turn.

15A77869BDFF409A8F63D675908E6AB5.description: interpreting vehicle position and driver action;

E850F9B917304D6484AB2A73B957C0C0.description:
The student will demonstrate the ability to communicate presence and intentions to other
highway transportation users. Key concepts/skills include

84D2DAE8E723490EB3371888343A7E90.description:
demonstrating an understanding of the integrated numbering system for highways within
the nationwide grid in the contiguous United States.

ED98931DD03B480AAA4F938F7F83672E.description:

E1551399F15245E19EF544AA14D58B7F.description:

5CF07664716E4D72B702EE6E4F240980.description: managing different types of interchanges (e.g., diamond, trumpet, cloverleaf);

050338CBC8B84FACA1C29E2FCB3CE5CD.description:

1D01C7613C0E48159E3CAFADB1FA1BDF.description: assessing and managing slope/grade of terrain; and

4FE69A9DA55E42629581F4AFC559E7EA.description: displaying responsible actions and safe response to roadway signs, signals, and markings;

608281FD330B4463996AB034C66A53CD.description:
analyzing and applying right-of-way rules and demonstrating appropriate communication

7A165A6F12F2462CBCE9F633DD6B04FE.description:
The student will demonstrate skills to make appropriate adjustments when approaching
controlled and uncontrolled intersections, curves, work zones, railroad crossings, and hills with
line-of-sight and path-of-travel limitations. Key concepts/skills include

CE45D597EBE4426281EED52539E8BD15.description:
identifying and adeptly responding to open and closed spaces and changes to line-of-sight

6627A9559BD0475B8845FB182AB60A95.description: estimating time and space needs for passing; and

148EB1C199B04256B87A546375809B2A.description:
selecting appropriate speed, maintaining adequate space, and skillfully judging time and

BBCD33319A92429088B20BF8B649893F.description: applying following distance, time and other space management concepts;

5401E8773D6B49CA9351AEF3C0FDD537.description:
synthesizing information visually from the driving environment using the Search,
Evaluate and Execute in Time (SEEiT) space-management decision-making process;

1607059268A4434FA64CF87109BABB0B.description:
The student will demonstrate the ability to manage visibility, time, and space to reduce
driving risks and avoid collisions. Key concepts/skills include

5528D237EB064C08AFAE5E3783B7038F.description:
analyzing the cause and severity of types of collisions, (i.e., head-on, near-frontal,
broadside, rear-end, rollover, sideswipe).

11A6FAD3614E4C71A5BCA8CED7532828.description:
demonstrating how to prevent and correctly manage front tire traction loss (understeer)
and rear tire traction loss (oversteer); and

FE433A13D39F42618F3BE43B63964D95.description:
identifying and accurately compensating for shifts in vehicle load (from side to side, front

4FFC45EC24874C25B3C3C66DA918BE49.description:
evaluating how steering, braking, and accelerating positively and negatively impact

3C598371CBE240E2B459BBB29CAD26D3.description: analyzing how sitting and hand position affect ergonomics and vehicle control;

02D07BC675E34D0997FA5C5ED9042BDB.description:
The student will identify how laws of physics (i.e., momentum, gravity, inertia) effect
force of impact. Key concepts/skills include

48B852233553452E880CDA123693DBB3.description:
The student will demonstrate the ability to use vehicle reference points and explain how
visual referencing skills aid in judging vehicle position and distance when executing basic
driving maneuvers for

B8EA467505B14227AC0BD5EE38212A38.description: applying efficient accelerating, braking, and steering techniques; and

C350D53A3A174A68991379DED6A97DBE.description:
interpreting and accurately responding to vehicle information, warning, and control

7324E628F8C945B6A14AB1C5B9851FD7.description: comparing starting procedures for automatic and manual transmissions;

2B98EDA44CB740529BDA2427AEFEB05E.description: understanding and sequentially demonstrating pre-driving procedures;

FAD93BF3D79541B580CFC29C7B97F3C5.description:
The student will demonstrate an understanding of basic vehicle operating procedures. Key
concepts/skills include

5CE42AA805934C61A682324E61EB08F5.description:
investigating the social implications and understanding the civic responsibility of the
organ- and tissue- donation designation process.

FFBC7812B98D4B3099D83B49A2C7F4DD.description:
comparing the Virginia Driver’s Manual information with the motor vehicle section of
the Code of Virginia; and

C26214B3A3C04BF9B0433265976C1C79.description: analyzing traffic safety information in the Virginia Driver’s Manual;

74361EF5777F492AA7F8230883DB6591.description:
demonstrating an understanding of graduated driver licensing requirements, types of
licenses, and required identification documentation;

47A46AA1EDC34A73BB5669A2303D9964.description:
The student will demonstrate an understanding of Virginia traffic laws, licensing
